ALL WELL AND GOOD.Defintion: If something is all very well, it is fairly useful or good in some situations but not excellent and not useful or good in every situation

ANYTHING BUT.Defintion: used to mean the opposite of the stated quality

AUCTION.Defintion: a usually public sale of goods or property, where people make higher and higher bids (= offers of money) for each thing, until the thing is sold to the person who will pay most

BACKERS.Defintion: someone who gives financial support to something

BANKRUPT.Defintion: unable to pay what you owe, and having had control of your financial matters given, by a law court, to a person who sells your property to pay your debts

BLOOM.Defintion: When a flower blooms, it opens or is open, and when a plant or tree blooms it produces flowers

BUDS.Defintion: a small part of a plant, that develops into a flower or leaf

BULB.Defintion: a round root of some plants from which the plant grows

BULBS.Defintion: a round root of some plants from which the plant grows

CARPENTER.Defintion: a person whose job is making and repairing wooden objects and structures

CHARACTERISTICS.Defintion: a typical or noticeable quality of someone or something

CRAZE.Defintion: an activity, object, or idea that is extremely popular, usually for a short time

CURRENCY.Defintion: the money that is used in a particular country at a particular time

DEBTS.Defintion: something, especially money, that is owed to someone else, or the state of owing something

EXAGGERATED.Defintion: seeming larger, more important, better, or worse than it really is

FACTORS.Defintion: a fact or situation that influences the result of something

FLAUNT.Defintion: to show or make obvious something you are proud of in order to get admiration

FLUSH WITH CASH.Defintion: having a lot of money to spend at a particular time

FOOL.Defintion: a person who behaves in a silly way without thinking

IN ANTICIPATION OF.Defintion: believing that something is going to happen

IN FOR A TREAT.Defintion: if someone is 'in for a treat', then they have something good waiting for them

IN INVERTED COMMAS.Defintion: used in spoken English after a word or phrase to show that it has not been used accurately or that the opposite meaning is intended

INEXPENSIVELY.Defintion: not costing a lot of money

INHERITED.Defintion: received from someone who has died

INTRINSIC.Defintion: being an extremely important and basic characteristic of a person or thing

LONG STORY SHORT.Defintion: used when you do not tell all the details

MAKE A QUICK BUCK.Defintion: to earn money quickly and easily, especially by doing something illegal or dishonest

MANIA.Defintion: a very strong interest in something that fills a person's mind or uses up all their time

ON ONE LEVEL.Defintion: something that you say when you are speaking about two opposite ways of thinking about or reacting to a situation

PANICKED.Defintion: suddenly felt so worried or frightened that you cannot think or behave calmly or reasonably

PEAK.Defintion: the highest, strongest, or best point, value, or level of skill

PRICE TAG.Defintion: a piece of paper with a price that is attached to a product, or the amount that something costs

RATIONALITY.Defintion: the quality of being based on clear thought and reason, or of making decisions based on clear thought and reason

REPORTEDLY.Defintion: according to what many people say

RIDE THE WAVE.Defintion: to be helped by being connected to something attractive or interesting

SEEDS.Defintion: an object produced by plants from which other plants grow

SHORT SUPPLY.Defintion: if something is in short supply, there isn't much of it

SHOW OFF.Defintion: to behave in a way that is intended to attract attention or admiration, and that other people often find annoying

SIX FIGURE SUM.Defintion: an amount of money of 100,000 or over

SIX FIGURE SUMS.Defintion: an amount of money of 100,000 or over

SKYROCKET.Defintion: to rise extremely quickly or make extremely quick progress towards success

SOUGHT AFTER.Defintion: wanted by many people and usually of high quality or rare

SPECULATING.Defintion: buying and selling in the hope that the value of what you buy will increase and that it can then be sold at a higher price in order to make a profit

TAKE THAT WITH A VERY LARGE PINCH OF SAL.Defintion: to not completely believe something that you are told, because you think it is unlikely to be true

TICKED A LOT OF THE BOXES.Defintion: met a lot of the criteria

TWOFOLD.Defintion: twice as big or as much
